metadata.synopsis: Dialogue with Meygan in Last Light. She is standing before an altar, mourning Yonas' death. She might give us something if we give her his sword. Despite changes in the state of the grove, she usually reverts to her normal dialogue/ state of sadness as she was close to Yonas and that's more to the front of her mind than stuff like Ketheric

2.speaker: Harper Meygan
2.text: Path to Moonrise is opening up. Time for vengeance.
2.context: NodeContext: bitter, preparing for battle but it's become personal

7.speaker: Harper Meygan
7.text: We need to end this quickly - before the shadows break through again.

10.speaker: Harper Meygan
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Has been crying - wipes away tearInternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet.NodeContext: Sad, like she's been crying

18.speaker: Harper Meygan
18.text: He was joking, this morning. Yonas, I mean.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks up to stand behind Meygan, but she doesn't look at them.InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet.

24.speaker: Harper Meygan
24.text: There was an ambush in the dark. The shadows dragged him away...

36.speaker: Harper Meygan
36.text: He was always joking. Said it was good for morale, but he just liked seeing people laugh.
36.context: NodeContext: Small pause before the line.

13.speaker: Harper Meygan
13.text: He was a good Harper. A good friend...
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after finishing this line

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I found his sword on his body. Would you like to have it?

47.speaker: Harper Meygan
47.text: I... yes, I'd like that. I don't know what to say.

5.speaker: Harper Meygan
5.text: He always took such good care of this... I'll do the same. For him.

34.speaker: Harper Meygan
34.context: NodeContext: Meygan stares into space for a few beats, fighting back tears. She steels herself and turns to face the player

44.speaker: Harper Meygan
44.text: I should thank you... take this.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Meygan takes object from inventory behind back and hands it to player.InternalNodeContext: Needs reward

17.speaker: Harper Meygan
17.text: I think I need some time by myself now.
17.context: NodeContext: After line she turns away from the player, as she brushes away tears.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I don't care what you say, so long as you pay.

61.speaker: Harper Meygan
61.text: Thought you were doing me a kindness. Stupid of me.
61.context: NodeContext: Tone hardening against the player's sudden mercenary streak.

56.speaker: Harper Meygan
56.text: Here. Take it and leave me be.

39.speaker: Harper Meygan
39.text: Got nothing to give you for it. Just... leave me be.

19.speaker: Harper Meygan
19.text: What is wrong with you? Just... leave me be.

51.speaker: Harper Meygan
51.text: I thought we could have been something more, one day, but...
51.context: NodeContext: Chokes up a little. Swallows back her tears.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I'm sure he knew. I'm sure he cared for you as well.

48.speaker: Harper Meygan
48.text: I don't know. And I never will.

29.speaker: Harper Meygan
29.text: I'm sorry, I'd like to be alone.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Hey - it will be all right.

20.speaker: Harper Meygan
20.text: No, he... Sorry, I - I'd like to be alone.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: It doesn't have to be too late.

0.speaker: Harper Meygan
0.text: What are you talking- gods, no!

11.speaker: Harper Meygan
11.text: I - I'd like to be alone.
11.context: NodeContext: Cold response to "you'll get over it"

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'm sure he'd appreciate your prayers.

23.speaker: Harper Meygan
23.text: I hope so. They're all I have to give.

21.speaker: Harper Meygan
21.text: Thank you. You're a good person.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Don't lose yourself in grief - many more will fall in battles to come.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: If you lose yourself to grief we will fall before the true battle begins. Harden your heart.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: There is no better death than to fall in battle. You should be happy for him!

40.speaker: Harper Meygan
40.text: Why would that make me happy? Sorry, I - I'd like to be alone.
40.context: NodeContext: horrified, Chokes up a little. Swallows back her tears.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I'm so sorry for your loss.

63.speaker: Harper Meygan
63.text: Sorry, I - I don't think I can talk right now.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: It's a dangerous life, being a soldier.

41.speaker: Harper Meygan
41.text: All the more reason to mourn the ones we lose.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Better at jokes than keeping himself alive, I hope.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Dead, is he? Maybe if he'd spent less time joking, he'd still be around.

53.speaker: Harper Meygan
53.context: NodeContext: She purses her lips, fighting back despair, anger and tears. She can barely speak.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Smart. Bit of levity before a daunting battle never hurt.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Humour helps on a hunt - it can be the spark when all hope is lost.

22.speaker: Harper Meygan
22.context: InternalNodeContext: Siege is over, but Haven doesn't have any protection anymore.NodeContext: With grit

27.speaker: Harper Meygan
27.context: NodeContext: bitter, preparing for battle but it's become personal

30.speaker: Harper Meygan
30.text: You must know better than any of us - we've got to get into the Towers. Now.

33.speaker: Harper Meygan
33.text: They're here. More of those things that killed Yonas. I won't let them take anyone else.
33.context: InternalNodeContext: Isobel is gone and Shadow Creatures are sieging the Haven. Some NPCs are in the basement.

45.speaker: Harper Meygan
45.text: I'd rather die myself than see another Harper taken.
45.context: InternalNodeContext: Isobel is gone and Shadow Creatures are sieging the Haven. Some NPCs are in the basement.

65.speaker: Harper Meygan
65.text: I don't care what it takes; this place will not fall.
65.context: InternalNodeContext: Siege is over, but Haven doesn't have any protection anymore.NodeContext: full of grit
